meanings.definition: The act or process of involving or entangling.
meanings.sent1: The involution of the situation made it difficult to unravel.
meanings.sent2: The involution of the plot kept the audience engaged.
meanings.sent3: The involution of the cords in the box made it a tangled mess.
meanings.sent4: The involution of the mystery deepened as more clues emerged.
meanings.sent5: The involution of the threads created a complex pattern.

meanings.definition: A complex mathematical function that is its own inverse.
meanings.sent1: Understanding the involution in math class was challenging.
meanings.sent2: The involution of the equation required careful calculation.
meanings.sent3: The involution of the numbers seemed like a puzzle to solve.
meanings.sent4: The involution of the formula revealed interesting patterns.
meanings.sent5: The involution of the variables led to surprising results.

meanings.definition: The shrinking or return of an organ to its normal size after enlargement.
meanings.sent1: The involution of the stomach after a big meal is natural.
meanings.sent2: Doctors monitor the involution of the uterus post-pregnancy.
meanings.sent3: The involution of the balloon animal made the kids giggle.
meanings.sent4: The involution of the sponge as it dried was fascinating to watch.
meanings.sent5: The involution of the fruit as it ripened was a gradual process.
